data.question: What is the empirical formula of Ca(squarate)?
What is the crystal system of Ca(squarate)?
What method was used to synthesize Ca(squarate)?
What is the adsorption selectivity of C2H2/C2H4 mixture for Ca(squarate)?
What is the BET surface area of Ca(squarate) after activation?
Why does Ca(squarate) show high adsorption selectivity for C2H2 over C2H4?
data.answer: Due to the strong π-π interactions and the high π-electronic density of the squaric ligand and C2H2 molecules.

data.question: Is Ca(squarate) stable when exposed to air or water?
data.answer: Yes, it demonstrates extraordinary structural stability when exposed to air or soaked in water.

data.question: What is the isosteric heat of adsorption for C2H2 on Ca(squarate) at zero coverage?
Can Ca(squarate) efficiently separate C2H4 from C2H6?
data.answer: Yes, it displayed a good separation performance for C2H4/C2H6 mixture with an adsorption selectivity of 5.9.

data.question: Is the synthesis of Ca(squarate) cost-efficient for large-scale industrial applications?
data.answer: Yes, its outstanding chemical stability and cost-efficient synthetic route are beneficial for large-scale industrial applications.

data.question: Does Ca(squarate) show molecular sieving effect for C2 hydrocarbons?
data.answer: No, despite its ideal pore size, it did not show molecular sieving effect for C2 hydrocarbons.

data.question: What is the main interaction between C2H2 molecules and Ca(squarate) framework?
data.answer: The main interaction is through strong π-π interactions and Hδ+…Oδ− multiple van der Waals interaction.

data.question: Is Ca(squarate) stable under humid conditions?
Does Ca(squarate) have a higher adsorption selectivity for C2H2/C2H4 mixture than for C2H4/C2H6 mixture?
Is the adsorption capacity of C2H2 higher than C2H4 and C2H6 in Ca(squarate) at low pressure?
Can Ca(squarate) be synthesized from expensive and rare precursors?
Does Ca(squarate) lose its porosity when exposed to air for two weeks?
Is the regeneration energy for Ca(squarate) high due to strong binding energies?
Does Ca(squarate) demonstrate a molecular sieving effect for C2H4 over C2H6?
Is Ca(squarate) unsuitable for industrial applications due to its chemical instability?
